snippet: Dr. de Duve, a Belgian biochemist whose discoveries shed light on genetic disorders like Tay-Sachs disease, shared the 1974 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with two others.
abstract: Dr Christian de Duve, a Belgian biochemist whose discoveries about the internal workings of cells shed light on genetic disorders that helped give birth to the field of modern cell biology, earning him a Nobel Prize, dies at age 95.
lead_paragraph: Dr. de Duve, a Belgian biochemist whose discoveries shed light on genetic disorders like Tay-Sachs disease, shared the 1974 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with two others.

headline.seo: Christian de Duve, Nobel-Winning Biochemist, Dies at 95
headline.main: Christian de Duve, 95, Dies; Nobel-Winning Biochemist
headline.print_headline: Christian de Duve, 95, Dies; Nobel-Winning Biochemist
